metadata.dc:description: A case is reported of left sudden hearing loss in a 29-year-old male with HIV infection and a history right sudden hearing loss 2 years earlier. The low frequency of sudden hearing loss in HIV+ patients is discussed. Neurosyphilis and cryptococcus infection were ruled out. The patient recovered his hearing in the left ear after three days of treatment with intravenous piracetam, 10 g/day.
metadata.dc:title: Sordera brusca e infección por el VIH.
[Sudden hearing loss and HIV infection].
